#How to build Gmock with Gradle

First of all, Gradle 0.5.2 is needed.

You can use the following commands:

  * `gradle clean`
    will remove the 'build' directory
  * `gradle test`
    will run the tests
  * `gradle`
    is the same as above
  * `gradle libs`
    will create the jar file (without jarjarified)
  * `gradle jarjarify`
    will jarjarified the jar file
  * `gradle integrationTest`
    will run the tests with the jarjarified jar file
  * `gradle dists`
    will package the jar file and all other additional files (e.g. source codes) (not finished)
  * `gradle release`
    is the same as above, but without '-SNAPSHOT' in the version
